title: Help me ID this pop song that goes "ay oh ay oh ay oh"
body:
This has been stuck in my head for the past several hours and it's been infuriating. In some part of the song, the male singer sings "ay oh ay oh ay oh". I heard it from the mall today so it must be a pop song. It also sounds slightly like EDM. It sounds like it was released around 2012-2015-ish. I've been searching all over Google, Reddit, and YouTube for the past 6 hours and I haven't gotten any close. It is driving me crazy. I will literally give one of my kidneys if any one of you could identify this song. Please help me
I've recorded a sample which I hope helps: https://vocaroo.com/12Y0LTxSjHCr

title: Remember the time when Billboard announced the top 10 rock songs of the 2010s and none of the songs were rock?
body:
For context, the list is:
1. Imagine Dragons - Believer
2. Imagine Dragons - Thunder
3. Imagine Dragons - Radioactive
4. Panic! At The Disco - High Hopes
5. The Lumineers - Ho Hey
6. Twenty One Pilots - Heathens
7. Walk The Moon - Shut Up And Dance
8. Portugal. The Man - Feel It Still
9. Twenty One Pilots - Ride
10. Twenty One Pilots - Stressed Out

What an absolute joke.

title: Thoughts on SZA - SOS?
body: I thought it was pretty good. How about you guys?

title: Fifty Fifty becomes longest-charting K-pop girl group on Billboard Hot 100
body:
Cupid just broke BLACKPINK and Dua Lipa - Kiss and Make Up's 12-week record on the Billboard Hot 100.
Link: https://en.yna.co.kr/view/AEN20230622002200315

title: How did Bad Bunny blow up?
body: I can't stand this guy. His voice and singing are both bad, and his rapping and songwriting skills are absolutely terrible. I'd be lying if I said he didn't have any good song instrumentals, but apart from that, that's really it. I don't really see anything else of value that would make me like this guy. So can anyone please explain to me why this guy is so big? It really is baffling.

title: What album do you think is perfect?
body: For me, Kind of Blue by Miles Davis. Overplayed, sure. Doesn't change a thing, though.

title: How to start listening to classical music?
body: I want to start listening to classical music. Where should one start? Any recommendations would be much appreciated. Thank you!

title: Why don't most people don't like country music?
body: I am completely aware that there are some (really) bad country songs out there, but to be fair, all genres have THE bad songs that people laugh at or don't want to talk about. But I really do feel like a lot of people hate country music, more so than any other genre. I sincerely hope that isn't just me thinking that. But anyway, to both country music fans, non-fans, and haters, what do you think puts people off when it comes to country music?

title: The future of alternative music
body: I find it pretty sad that among my friends, I am the only one who listens to alternative and indie rock. They all just listen to your typical, generic pop and rap. While I respect the fact that people have different tastes, which is quite evident, it makes me feel lonely, like I can't even talk to them about the music I love. Instead, I have to consult strangers on the internet I've never seen or met before. I'm just worried that someday, alternative music will just completely fade into obscurity never to be seen again, and I feel like I will really struggle in relating to other people's tastes in music. Thoughts?

title: Is Pop still even considered a genre at this point or is it genre-less already?
body: The title says it all. Does pop mean "popular music" now and it can comprise various genres or is it still considered "pop" as a music genre of songs? For me, I always considered pop as a genre of music with a unique sound, regardless if the songs are popular or not. But lately, people have been referring to pop music as songs that are popular. Just like Old Town Road, for instance, I don't think it's a pop song, but how about for you?

title: What really is alternative music, and why is Billie Eilish fit in this genre?
body: I’m a heavy pop music genre fan, but I just don’t understand why Billie is considered alternative… Any thoughts?

title: Rock music is not dead, it’s just not in the trend these days
body:
I would admit that the majority of the music I listen to is actually current, and I mostly listen to rock music. Although many people think of rock music as being from the 1990s (or earlier), there has been a lot of excellent rock music released in the previous 10 years alone, not to mention in the recent year. Additionally, the majority of individuals will have very little exposure to them. I don't mind if people listen to music from various genres; my friends are all Drake and Taylor Swift fans, which isn't really my style, but it's their choice.
 
I check Billboard Top 10 every month and become tired with every song, but I won't claim it's because rock music is "boring." Like, something isn't always wonderful just because it sounds "new" or something like that. The other aspect is its mentality. Rock is strangely viewed like jazz, a remnant of the past, despite the fact that new rock performers, all of whom are young people, release albums almost every year. To put that into perspective, I'm in my late 20s.

title: Are the Beastie Boys respected in the rap community?
body: Not looking for a negative discussion or something. The Beastie Boys were literally so popular and have attracted so many fans, but do we rap fans consider them as great as Tupac or Eminem in the rap industry (not necessarily saying they are as big as these two artists but respected for what they have reached in their career)?

title: Immature by FLO is just SO GOOD
body: So there’s this new all-female group called FLO, and wow I was amazed by their song Immature when I first heard it in Tiktok.

title: What are your favorite classical pieces?
body: As I was browsing through my music library full of classical albums, I can’t help but think about my most favorite classical piece. In the end, I decided that Romance in f minor op. 11 by Antonin Dvorak is my most favorite because it touches my soul deeply when I listen to it and it reminds me of all the struggles I endured growing up. What about yours?

title: I want to explore jazz music, but I don’t know where to start… HELP PLS
body: Title says it all folks!

title: K-pop idols debuting are getting way too young
body: Am I the only one that finds it weird that most kpop group debuting these days are minors? They should be in school studying like… Instead, they’re getting trained at these Korean agencies at such a young age for years, and then debuting under 15 years old, which is crazy.

title: I'm not from the United States, therefore is it strange that I enjoy country music?
body: LeAnn Rimes, Faith Hill, Shania Twain, Rascal Flatts, and Lonestar are a few of my favorite musicians. I dunno, some Americans might find it surprising that I enjoy country music. I feel incredibly connected to country music for some reason. Do you find it strange?

title: Stanning Latin Artists
body:
Do you know why stan culture is not present in Latin music, unlike pop, k-pop, and rnb genres? Generally, I think of two reasons:

1.  Latin artists are always making collabs with other artists to promote themselves, which means artists share the same fanbases. The fans do not become hardly-obsessed to just one artist, and instead becomes a fan of the genre.
2.  Each country always has one main pop artist, so there isn’t really competition for them, which is why stan culture is so easy to grow in that genre.
